definition[0]: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
example[0]: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
definition[1]: a part of your body that is tender is painful if someone touches it
example[1]: My arm is still tender where I bruised it.
definition[2]: gentle and careful in a way that shows love
example[2]: Her voice was tender and soft.
definition[3]: easily damaged – used especially about plants or flowers
example[4]: tender plants that were killed by the harsh winter
definition[4]: to formally offer or show something to someone
example[5]: As company secretary, you must tender the proposal.
example[6]: Minton tendered her resignation on Friday.
example[7]: The seller has the right to keep the goods until payment is tendered to him.
definition[5]: to make a formal offer to do a job or provide goods or services for a particular price
example[8]: We are unable to tender competitively for the contract.
definition[6]: a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services
example[9]: Our bid was the lowest tender.
example[10]: The contract for building the houses will be put out to tender.
definition[7]: a small boat that takes people or supplies between the shore and a larger boat
definition[8]: part of a steam train used for carrying coal and water for the train
definition[9]: an offer to do a job or provide goods or services for a particular price, usually as part of a competition between several companies for the same work
example[11]: Their bid was £150,000 more than the lowest tender.
example[12]: Councillors agreed that the contract to build the homes should be put out to (=offered for) tender.
definition[10]: an offer to buy shares, which will be sold to the investor who offers the highest amount
example[13]: Some tender offers stipulate a minimum price for offers.
definition[11]: an offer of the exact amount of money in CASH (=coins and notes) needed to pay for something
definition[12]: to make a formal offer to do a job or provide goods or services at a particular price
example[14]: The company said it is unable to tender competitively for contracts unless it has the flexibility of Sunday working.
definition[13]: to make a formal offer to buy or sell shares at a particular price

definition[14]: to offer or show something to someone
example[17]: She will tender a proposal at the meeting.
